meanings.definition: Relating to the clergy or their work.
meanings.sent1: The clerical duties of the priest involve leading prayers and conducting religious ceremonies.
meanings.sent2: The clerical robes worn by the bishop were ornate and symbolized his religious authority.
meanings.sent3: The clerical collar worn by the pastor was accidentally swapped with a regular shirt, causing confusion during the service.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a clerical tone, as if she held the wisdom of the ages in her words.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the stained glass windows, casting a clerical glow over the church.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to office work or a clerk.
meanings.sent1: The clerical tasks included organizing files and typing up reports for the manager.
meanings.sent2: Her clerical skills in data entry and spreadsheet management were highly valued in the office.
meanings.sent3: The clerical error in the financial report led to confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent4: The clerical efficiency of the secretary ensured that all documents were processed promptly.
meanings.sent5: The clerical desk was neatly arranged with pens, papers, and a computer for daily tasks.

meanings.definition: A person who works in an office, especially doing administrative work.
meanings.sent1: The clerical greeted visitors at the front desk and directed them to the appropriate departments.
meanings.sent2: She started her career as a clerical and gradually moved up to a managerial position.
meanings.sent3: The clerical's cheerful demeanor brightened up the office environment on gloomy days.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling office, the clerical was the backbone of organization and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The new clerical quickly adapted to the office procedures and became an integral part of the team.
